item.title: The Monaco Motel: A Royal Connection on the Las Vegas Strip - Vintage Vegas History
item.description:
A Brief Reign on Las Vegas Boulevard

The Las Vegas Strip wasn’t always the glittering behemoth it is today. In the late 1950s, the south end of the Strip was still developing, filled with smaller motels and burgeoning casinos. Nestled at 3073 South Las Vegas Boulevard, the Monaco Motel opened its doors in 1958, aiming to capitalize on this growing tourism boom. While it lacked the lavish grandeur of the Sands or the Flamingo, the Monaco carved out a small but memorable niche for itself.
